page.title: 01MAIN FEATURES OF ST TEATH
page.content: THE AREA IS RURAL WITH UNSPOILT COUNTRYSIDE AND IS CLOSE TO THE COAST AND BODMIN MOOR. THE AREA INCLUDES THE TINY VILLAGES OF TRELILL, MICHAELSTOW AND TREVEIGHAN AS WELL AS ST.TEATH, A SMALL COMPACT PLACE WITH A 14TH CENTURY CHURCH,CLOCK TOWER,"WHITE HART" INN,VICTORIAN SCHOOL BUILDING AND CELTIC CROSS IN THE CEMETERY. THE DISUSED TREBURGETT MINE IS A PLACE OF INTEREST AS IS THE ROUTE OF THE DISUSED NORTH CORNWALL RAILWAY. THE RIVER ALLEN VALLEY IS A BEAUTIFUL WOODED VALLEY THROUGH WHICH THE A39 TRUNK ROAD RUNS. A CAMPAIGN TO PREVENT ROAD IMPROVEMENTS SPOILING THE VALLEY WAS FOUGHT AND WON IN THE 1970'S. THE AREA IS NOTED FOR ITS"FRIENDLY" ATMOSPHERE AND SLATED BUILDINGS. IT IS POPULAR WITH HOLIDAYMAKERS SOME OF WHOM OWN HOLIDAY HOMES HERE.
